section_text: 2 1 A person who holds an office listed in the First Schedule to this Act shall vacate that office on the day on which he attains the age of   75 . 2 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

5 The annual amount of any pension granted under the Lord Chancellor’s Pension  Act 1832 for service as Lord Chancellor shall, in the case of a person who resigns that office after the commencement of this Act be five thousand pounds and any Letters Patent issued under that Act before the commencement of this Act shall have effect accordingly.
12 This Act may be cited as the Judicial Pensions Act 1959.
